meanings.definition: The act of bestowing or granting something, such as an award or degree.
meanings.sent1: The conferral of the trophy brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent2: The conferral of the certificate marked the end of her studies.
meanings.sent3: The conferral of the title of 'Best Dancer' went to the cat in the costume.
meanings.sent4: The conferral of the honor was like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The conferral of the prize made her heart dance with joy.

meanings.definition: The formal giving of a title or honor.
meanings.sent1: After the conferral of the crown, she became the queen.
meanings.sent2: The conferral of the medal was a proud moment for the athlete.
meanings.sent3: The conferral of the 'Best Chef' title went to the cat who burnt the toast.
meanings.sent4: The conferral of the award was a shining moment in her career.
meanings.sent5: The conferral of the badge made him stand a little taller.

meanings.definition: The act of conferring or discussing something with others.
meanings.sent1: The conferral of ideas during the meeting led to a breakthrough.
meanings.sent2: The conferral of opinions helped them reach a decision.
meanings.sent3: The conferral of the plan over lunch made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The conferral of thoughts in the brainstorming session sparked creativity.
meanings.sent5: The conferral of solutions made the problem seem smaller.
